# Concurrent File Edits (AKA Multi-File Edits)

Edit multiple files in a single operation, dramatically speeding up refactoring and multi-file changes.

* * *

## What It Does [​](https://docs.roocode.com/features/experimental/concurrent-file-edits\#what-it-does "Direct link to What It Does")

![Batch diff approval interface showing multiple file changes](https://docs.roocode.com/img/concurrent-file-edits/concurrent-file-edits-1.png)

Concurrent File Edits allows Roo to modify multiple files in your workspace within a single request. Instead of approving each file edit individually, you review and approve all changes at once through a unified batch approval interface.

* * *

## Why Use It [​](https://docs.roocode.com/features/experimental/concurrent-file-edits\#why-use-it "Direct link to Why Use It")

**Traditional approach**: Sequential file edits requiring individual approvals

- Edit file A → Approve
- Edit file B → Approve
- Edit file C → Approve

**With Concurrent File Edits**: All changes presented together

- Review all proposed changes across files A, B, and C
- Approve once to apply all changes

This reduces interruptions and speeds up complex tasks like:

- Refactoring functions across multiple files
- Updating configuration values throughout your codebase
- Renaming components and their references
- Applying consistent formatting or style changes

* * *

## How to Enable [​](https://docs.roocode.com/features/experimental/concurrent-file-edits\#how-to-enable "Direct link to How to Enable")

Experimental Feature

Multi-File Edits is an experimental feature and must be enabled in settings.

1. Open Roo Code settings (click the gear icon in Roo Code)
2. Navigate to **Roo Code > Experimental Settings**
3. Enable the **Enable multi-file edits** option

![Enable multi-file edits toggle in experimental settings](https://docs.roocode.com/img/concurrent-file-edits/concurrent-file-edits.png)

* * *

## Using the Feature [​](https://docs.roocode.com/features/experimental/concurrent-file-edits\#using-the-feature "Direct link to Using the Feature")

When enabled, Roo automatically uses concurrent edits when appropriate. You'll see a "Batch Diff Approval" interface showing:

- All files to be modified
- Proposed changes for each file
- Options to approve all changes or review individually

### Example Workflow [​](https://docs.roocode.com/features/experimental/concurrent-file-edits\#example-workflow "Direct link to Example Workflow")

1. Ask Roo to "Update all API endpoints to use the new authentication method"
2. Roo analyzes your codebase and identifies all affected files
3. You receive a single batch approval request showing changes across:
   - `src/api/users.js`
   - `src/api/products.js`
   - `src/api/orders.js`
   - `src/middleware/auth.js`
4. Review all changes in the unified diff view
5. Approve to apply all changes simultaneously

* * *

## Technical Details [​](https://docs.roocode.com/features/experimental/concurrent-file-edits\#technical-details "Direct link to Technical Details")

This feature leverages the [`apply_diff`](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/apply-diff#experimental-multi-file-edits-multi_file_apply_diff) tool's experimental multi-file capabilities. For detailed information about the implementation, XML format, and how the `MultiFileSearchReplaceDiffStrategy` works, see the [apply\_diff documentation](https://docs.roocode.com/advanced-usage/available-tools/apply-diff#experimental-multi-file-edits-multi_file_apply_diff).

* * *

## Best Practices [​](https://docs.roocode.com/features/experimental/concurrent-file-edits\#best-practices "Direct link to Best Practices")

### When to Enable [​](https://docs.roocode.com/features/experimental/concurrent-file-edits\#when-to-enable "Direct link to When to Enable")

- Using capable AI models (Claude 3.5 Sonnet, GPT-4, etc.)
- Comfortable reviewing multiple changes at once

### When to Keep Disabled [​](https://docs.roocode.com/features/experimental/concurrent-file-edits\#when-to-keep-disabled "Direct link to When to Keep Disabled")

- Working with less capable models that might struggle with complex multi-file contexts
- Prefer reviewing each change individually

* * *

## Limitations [​](https://docs.roocode.com/features/experimental/concurrent-file-edits\#limitations "Direct link to Limitations")

- **Experimental**: This feature is still being refined and may have edge cases
- **Model dependent**: Works best with more capable AI models
- **Token usage**: Initial requests may use more tokens due to larger context
- **Complexity**: Very large batch operations might be harder to review

* * *

## Troubleshooting [​](https://docs.roocode.com/features/experimental/concurrent-file-edits\#troubleshooting "Direct link to Troubleshooting")

### Changes Not Batching [​](https://docs.roocode.com/features/experimental/concurrent-file-edits\#changes-not-batching "Direct link to Changes Not Batching")

- Verify the experimental flag is enabled in settings
- Check that your model supports multi-file operations
- Ensure files aren't restricted by `.rooignore`

### Approval UI Not Appearing [​](https://docs.roocode.com/features/experimental/concurrent-file-edits\#approval-ui-not-appearing "Direct link to Approval UI Not Appearing")

- Update to the latest version of Roo Code
- Check VS Code's output panel for errors
- Try disabling and re-enabling the feature

### Performance Issues [​](https://docs.roocode.com/features/experimental/concurrent-file-edits\#performance-issues "Direct link to Performance Issues")

- For very large batches, consider breaking the task into smaller chunks
- Monitor token usage if working with limited API quotas

* * *
